bio.p: Nazli El Samaloty joined the US Army Natick Soldier Center in April of 2006 as an Operations Research Analyst on the Modeling and Analysis Team. She has a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the Boston University’s School of Management with a Concentration in Finance and a minor in International Relations.

Roger Schleper is a Senior Operations Research Analyst on the Modeling Analysis Team at the US Army Natick Soldier Center. He brings over twenty years experience to the government as an analyst, supporting programs in both the Army and the Marine Corps. Roger has an extensive background on the inner workings and methodologies of the Infantry Warrior Simulation (IWARS) and earned his Masters of Science in Mathematics from Southern Illinois University.

Mary Anne Fawkes is a Technical Editor/Writer for the Modeling Analysis Team at the US Army Natick Soldier Center. She joined the team in July of 2001. Mary Anne has a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from Emanuel College.

Dean C. Muscietta leads the Army Materiel Systems Analysis Activity’s IWARS efforts. He has experience in systems development, test and evaluation, operations research and systems performance analysis. He holds a B.E. in electrical engineering from Stevens Institute of Technology and a M.S. in operations research from the Florida Institute of Technology.
